org.flowvisor.api

Class FVUserAPIImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flowvisor.api.FVUserAPIImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FVUserAPI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FVUserAPIJSONImpl, FVUserAPIXMLRPCImpl

    public class FVUserAPIImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements FVUserAPI
    This is the actual UserAPI that gets wrapped via XMLRPC In theory ("God willin' and the creek dun rise"), XMLRPC calls will call these function directly
    Author:
    capveg

      • createSlice

        public java.lang.Boolean createSlice(java.lang.String sliceName,
                            java.lang.String passwd,
                            java.lang.String controller_url,
                            java.lang.String drop_policy,
                            java.lang.String slice_email)
                              throws MalformedControllerURL,
                                     InvalidSliceName,
                                     InvalidDropPolicy,
                                     PermissionDeniedException,
                                     DuplicateControllerException
        Create a new slice (without flowspace) Slices that contain the field separator are rewritten with underscores
        Specified by:
        createSlice in interface FVUserAPI
        Parameters:
        sliceName - Cannot contain FVConfig.FS == '!'
        passwd - Cleartext! FIXME
        controller_url - Reference controller pseudo-url, e.g., tcp:hostname[:port]
        slice_email - As a contract for the slice
        drop_policy - Currently takes either 'exact' or 'rule', defines the drop policy for a slice when the controller is off-line.
        Returns:
        success
        Throws:
        InvalidSliceName
        PermissionDeniedException
        DuplicateControllerException
        MalformedControllerURL
        InvalidDropPolicy

                              throws SliceNotFound,
                                     PermissionDeniedException,
                                     ConfigError
        Description copied from interface: FVUserAPI
        Delete the named slice Requestor only has permission to delete its own slice or the slice that it (transitively) created. Since root has transitively created all slices, root can delete all slices.

        Success

      • setMaximumFlowMods

        public boolean setMaximumFlowMods(java.lang.String sliceName,
                         java.lang.String dpid,
                         java.lang.String maxFlowMods)
                           throws PermissionDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: FVUserAPI
        Set the maximum number of flow mods per slice per dpid. If dpid is set to any then the global slice limit applies. If no value is set then the number of slices is limitless.
        Specified by:
        setMaximumFlowMods in interface FVUserAPI
        Parameters:
        sliceName - - slice to apply the limit to.
        dpid - - dpid to apply limit to
        maxFlowMods - - the limit
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PermissionDeniedException
